name: Sandals Whitehouse European Village and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually do not stay at all inclusive resorts. I like to get a true feel for where I am and believed that you could not do this at an all inclusive. Staying at Sandals Whitehouse proved me wrong. The food was delicious and authentic to Jamaica. The entertainment was very good as well. I would have gone out of my way to see these performances that were brought to us at the resort. The beach was awesome. It was like we had the place to ourselves. There were always beach chairs and rafts in the pool available to use. The drive to the resort is scary, but if it wasn't there would be more people there.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After two and half years of wedded bliss I finally convinced my husband that we needed to go on a honeymoon. The selection process was long, but we decided on Sandals Whitehouse because it appeared to offer what we were looking for: a laid back, beach resort where we could play in the water. We cannot say for one second that our trip to Whitehouse was anything short of perfection. Absolutely effort from Whitehouse to make our trip relaxing, romantic, and wonderful was put forth, with a smile.
reviews.title: A honeymoon of perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our one, and only one, complaint about the experience were the noisy pool patrons. The volleyball net was up all day, everyday, and that drew a rowdy crowd. We would suggest to Whitehouse that they put the net up for certain times of the day to make the pool area a little more inviting to those who want romance and peace, instead of drunken fools.
reviews.title: Amazing trip to Sandals Whitehouse!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Sandals Whitehouse from April 4-18. We have stayed at other 5 star resorts in the Caribbean, however this was our first time to Jamaica. As we were there for two weeks and one of them was Reunion Week we were able to see and do a lot of things. Overall this resort was amazing and we would definately return.
reviews.title: I was really hoping I could give it a 10....7 will have to do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The trip from airport was less than an hour and a half becuase our driver drove quiet speedy. However this didn't bother my husband and I as we actually enjoyed the ride. It provided a great tour of the island. When we arrived at the resort checkin was quick and at 9:00 a.m. the weather was absolutely wonderful. Our room was on the second floor in the italian village and our view was great. The room was kept clean for our entire stay and there was turndown service every evening. We didn't have concierge service,however we didn't really feel that it was necessary. Although the resort was nearly full we rarely waited for a table at the restuarants and we had no need for alcohol in the room (since there is plenty of alcohol at the bars and restaurants).
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new husband and I stayed here from June 2nd through the 7th for our honeymoon and to be honest with you I have a mixed review of the resort. First off I would like to say that I have never been to Jamaica before let alone an all inclusive resort so I really have nothing to compare this to.......
reviews.title: Jamaican Honeymoon

likes.disliked: — Food, nightlife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were originally booked at Sandals Montego Bay simply because it was more affordable and we werent sure about making the 90 minute trip to the other side of the island. About a week before the trip we were called by our travel agent who said we were selected for an upgrade to Sandals Whitehouse and we would be upgraded to the honeymoon suite. Of course we were thrilled and actually felt like we had somehow cheated the system by paying such a low rate and then receiving this upgrade for free.....
reviews.title: Best Resort Ever!!

likes.disliked: — The long drive from the airport but it is worth it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to a delayed flight out of JFK we unfortunatey arrived in Jamaica around 4:30. Afer walking into the Sandals lounge we quickly walked right out as there were a lot of screaming kids in there and that was not something we wanted to deal with after our 11 hour journey began just for a free Red Stripe. It took about 2 minutes or so for our shuttle to get there and escort us on our way. The man taking our bags to the the shuttle said" I will take care of your bags and then you will take care of me," Granted I know he is not a Sandals employee but I was slightly astonished that Jamaicans would be this blunt if not borderline rude. I dismissed the comment because I know this is how they make their living, and I tipped him just the same but it left a bad taste in my mouth........We we unlucky enough to be leaving the airport at around 5:00 or so and apparently there is rush hour traffic everywhere, because it took us about an hour to make it through the small strech of town before you get to the mountains. There were several young girls in the middle of the road trying to sell donuts and a couple of men knocked on the window trying to sell us "small brown bags" of something. Yes, the roads are small and there are no guardrails while you are climbing up the mountain but I genuinely enjoyed the trip. It really puts things into perspective when you see such poverty and makes me really appreciate that much more.....I also have extreme motion sickness and despite the fact we were stuck in traffic after witnessing an accident with a dumptruck and a car which led to a 4 HOUR ride I was okay. Our driver was nice and we tipped him accordingly. This was the last tip that we gave until the time we departed.
reviews.title: Just when you think it can't get any better....Sandals rises to the occasion!

likes.liked: — THe upgraded room to a Butler Suite
likes.disliked: — bug bites

reviews.title: the time of our lives!
reviews.text: We arrived at Sandals at about 9:30 p.m. and were greeted with those lime smelling towels and plastic champagne glasses. But because it was so late and it was wet and rainy the towel only made me colder. However, I do appreciate the thought behind it and the man who gave it to me that seemed so eager....You wait in the lobby for someone to come and help you with check in and I enjoyed chatting with the couple that was on the shuttle with us. It was a very short wait and we were on our way to our room soon after arriving. As I mentioned it had just rained and everything was dark and wet. I didnt see any sign of nightlife but I did see a few couples walking around with a complimentary umbrella. We had a room on the 4th floor in the French village and found that it is quite a walk from the lobby and main "hub" of restaurants and shops. In the days to come I saw LOTS of people being driven to their rooms after checking in and although I am a healthy person who goes to the gym several times a week I would have preffered being driven in the rain rather than walking. But again it wasnt a big deal and let me further state that I am trying to give you the honest details of what to expect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While here we tried to do the scuba diving and went to the water activities building to sign up and was told that I couldnt scuba because I have asthma and although I have an inhaler and havent had an attack in more than a year I would need a release from my doctor. So make sure if this is something you want to do either have a release or prepare to lie. I wish someone had told me this before I went. Snorkeling was okay but our second time around I was vomiting off the side of the boat so if you get seasick skip this one........
reviews.title: Loved Sandals Whitehouse!!!

likes.liked: — friendly staff, nice beach, great drinks
likes.disliked: — service at pool bar varied, draft beer was the only option outside of your stocked fridge

reviews.title: No Problems Man No sand flies either
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived on Nov23rd and stayed for 10 days. We had a penthouse conceirge room. We stayed in Dutch village on the 4th floor. The view was amazing. Yes we had a 1 1/2 hour bus ride but we knew ahead of time. So we were prepared. alot of people are complaining about this, but it is not the resorts fault. maybe Jamaica should build more airports. One in Negril and one in Ocho Rios. Anyways the resort was amazing. The view of the ocean and mts. was wonderful. This was a beach with no rough water and no waves. You can actually swim in this ocean. If you walk out in the water and look down you can see a starfish here and there. Every village had there own pools. You had your choice of large pool with activities with a swim up bar or the quiet pool in Dutch village or french pool with restaraunt and swim up bar. My wife and I would actually walk the beach after breakfast. They had several hobie cats and water bikes and kayaks. We used these several times. The food we thought was great. I am a meat and potatoes guy. I had great meals every day. Some Islands that we have been to, alot of people got sick. I have been to Jamaica 3 times and never heard of anyone getting sick. As far as the sandflies are concerned, we only heard of 1 person with like 2-3 bites. every time we travel everyone freaks out about the sand flies. We always bring OFF with 97% Deet in it. We use this 1-2 nights before going out and have never got anything at all. Antigua was the worst, many people look like the had chicken pox but with our OFF we got no bites at all. We took many excursions and pretty much did everything and we went to all restaraunts. So feel free to e-mail me any questions Mexico55@comcast.net. Hey fellow crocs I miss you guys

reviews.title: First of Many Sandals Vacations!!
reviews.text: This was our first trip to a Sandals resort and we had a FABULOUS time!

reviews.text: Being a resourceful person by nature, I had compared many all-inclusive resorts for many weeks before choosing a Sandals resort. Sandals Whitehouse seemed the best choice, as my husband and I love the European decor, upscale nightlife/restaurants, and resort privacy.

The beach walkway is such a great new addition which makes it easier to get to and from different areas. We loved sitting on the couches at the fire pits at night, meeting and talking to so many nice couples from all over the world.

reviews.text: How people can find fault with this beautiful place is beyond me. Yes, the ride is 1 1/2 hours, but this is something people should already be aware of and ready for. There is construction along the way where they are working hard to improve the road conditions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent in all restaurants. We loved eating dinner outside at Neptunes and had 2 fabulous meals there with Camille as our wonderful and efficient waitress one night. The breakfast buffet at Bayside was always good, and we looked forward to seeing Maygan greet us with her beautiful smile. One of our favorite bartenders was Jermaine who was always smiling and walking along the beach offering up yummy drinks as well as greeting us at the French pool swim up bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we were there, most days would start out sunny with blue skies, but by noon clouds would start to appear, and the wind would pick up, some days with occasional big gusts. It didn't rain during the day, though, just a shower or two at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK the coach trip is a little bumpy but worth it to see the scenery & the real Jamaica (you won't believe people live in those little shacks, very humbling). The resort is magnificent - a long beautiful beach (get up early to walk outside the boundary & watch pelicans dive for fish, & see the vultures. Security guards check you in & out for safety). Breakfast is amazing - such a good choice & Derval with his excellent mimosas, white gloves & huge smile is a highlight. He's a big Arsenal fan for anyone from England! Definitely our favourite member of staff, and that is saying something as they are all so good.
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing holiday, a little paradise

likes.disliked: — Disco & going home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A choice of three excellent pools ranging from busy with activities to quiet with none, some great swim-up bars, a beach bar, & friendly staff. All spotlessly clean, tons of sunbeds & loads of towels. That applies to the beach too. Early morning staff throw out the sea urchins & star fish from the roped swimming areas & are happy to tell you all about the sea creatures & show you them. The beaches are raked & sprayed every day. You do get a few sand flea bites but they're not too bad. No mossie bites due to the citronella candles at night. The food is excellent wherever you choose to eat ( I can't believe the complaints on here!) & such a good choice with lots of different restaurants. We had no trouble getting into any restaurant - a few times we had to wait half an hour but when you are sipping champagne outside in such a great location listening to music, who cares! The steel bands were excellent & the soul singer in the Martini bar was great too. The disco could be better - maybe play more older & better known tunes for the age of the clientele.
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven

likes.disliked: — Web TV access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The glass bottom boat is good - and there are plenty of watersports if you find the energy. If you are into tennis the free lessons are excellent - from a professional who qualified in Florida & such fun, and the gym is very good too. The dance lessons are fun but there is no pressure to take part.
reviews.title: Secluded and tropical, but keep your expectations in check

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only booked a standard room but it was enormous with a big four poster bed, luxury bathroom & right on the beach with a palm tree by the door. And the maids come in to clean & make it up twice a day. Tips are really discouraged here, but we did give our maid a present on the side (they like English/American shower gels, toiletries etc). Everywhere the service was fantastic -the staff seemed to love their jobs & they couldn't do enough for us. Apparently Sandals pay better than anywhere in Jamaica (but they do work hard) & everyone wants to work there so the standard of service is really high. The owner visited while we were there. We didn't regret not having a butler - you are so spoiled without one!
reviews.title: Loved Whitehouse!!

likes.liked: — The location - very isolated and beautiful!
likes.disliked: — Nothing to complain about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the optional trips are a long drive from here as the resort is in an unspoiled nature reserve - the only near ones are the Black River crocodile trip (really good & you are so close to the wild crocs you can touch them, very good guides & great scenery) & the Horse Riding. That was a real highlight for us. You ride through the forest, learning stuff along the way, then when you get to the beach you go down to swimming costumes & change saddles & the horses run in the sea. Not too fast, & the horses are very well behaved. They are so well cared for too- each horse does only one trip every day or so & they breed from them, also take in ex-racehorses etc. Suggest taking a disposable camera so you can get some photos - the staff will take those. A lot of people said the other trips were too much driving so we just went for these two & really enjoyed them.
reviews.title: No bugs, no fuss, nothing but sun & fun Mon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sandals Whitehouse is absolutely amazing. We stayed there from August 24-August 29, 2006 for vacation. The resort is gorgeous, beautiful landscaping, white beaches, spacious. We never felt cramped, Sandals Whitehouse is such a large resort that it always feels as though it is a slow time. The staff is remarkable, they seem just as happy to be there as the guests are. It has three different themed areas, French, Italian, and Dutch. We stayed in the Italian and it was perfect, basically right in the middle of the resort so we were close to everything, although with how beautiful the resort is, walking from one end to the other is nothing to complain about. We booked in concierge level room, and when we got there they upgraded us to concierge suite. The food and drinks are also wonderful...plenty of options. Have a dirty banana and visit Tummings, the bartender at the main pool bar. I enjoyed eating at Bayside. The atmosphere was so relaxing, the outside tables are right along the beach with a beautiful fountain next to them. They served a large buffet for breakfast every morning. Monday nights they have a huge dinner buffet which is to die for, they have ice sculptures and so much variety you won't know where to start. I thought Eleanor's would be my favorite restaurant but it ended up being my least favorite. Giuseppe's chicken parm. is a must. As for excursions...we did the YS Falls excursion and the Fonthill horseback riding excursion and they were both worth every penny. I wouldn't recommend either of these for anyone who cannot move around easily as it can be a bit physically demanding, but they were both such wonderful experiences. At the YS Falls excursion you actually climb through the falls, and the guys there are willing to take as many pictures for you as you want. You can also swing off of ropes into the falls. Take water shoes. It is about a 45 min. drive there. With the horseback riding we were first time riders and no problems at all...it may just take a few minutes to get the feel of being on a horse but the horses are extremely well-trained. You ride through a path in a wooded area to the beach where you ride through the water. If you go, say hello to Prince Charles for me! This excursion is about a 20 min. drive there. Remember to take money with you for tipping as the excursions and the drivers to and from are not part of Sandals. We did not do the spa, although we did tour the facilities which are amazing, and even booked treatments but ended up cancelling due to sunburn. This resort really is nothing short of a tropical paradise. I've heard people complain of the ride to the resort from the airport which is an hour and a half ride, but it is nothing to complain about. I actually really enjoyed it as it allows you to see parts of Jamaica you probably wouldn't see otherwise. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a getaway from the realworld. You are treated like royalty, but please remember to show respect and courtesy to all the staff as they are very deserving of it.
reviews.title: A remote paradise

likes.liked: — Take watershoes for excursions, bug spray, YS Falls and Fonthill Horseback Riding lots of fun!

reviews.text: dropped SWH (Jeremy Jones) a line asking if they stocked Pernod, they did not but they said they'd try and locate some for us. Sure enough, some time later I got a mail telling me that they had some Pernod in stock now. Slight problem was the blackcurrant cordial which they could not locate for us on the island, no probs we said, we can bring some of that from home ! So far so good, excellent service we felt. A week or so before we were due to arrive I mailed them again, we particularly wanted to see the ocean and sunsets from our room. I was concerned since I understood that as we had booked the lowest room category our view may be obscured by the trees/bushes or whatever. Within a few hours I had received a reply saying that an upper floor in the Dutch area would give us the best sunset views and that they would see if they could accommodate our wishes. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first impression the resort provided after a long day of travel was horrible! Upon arrival, we had to complete paper work that was already included in our reservation and then they would not take us to our room because it was raining. We asked for an umbrella and they said they did not have any available, but we saw staff with umbrellas. Also, it rained almost everyday between 2 and 6. We decided to ask for directions to a restaurant after sitting for 30 minutes and just got wet. After we ate we made our way to our room without any assistance. Our room was on the second floor and all we could see was trees, not ocean and we booked and ocean view. I was told the room I was in was an upgrade but it had a bad view and the a/c was not working well. We were moved the next day to a room on the 3rd floor, but it was at the edge of the property in the french complex. The service was horrible with the exception of about 10% of the staff. It appeared the only way to get service was if you were on your 10th stay, but I do not know why anybody would make it past their first stay. The restaurants were okay, but the menus were limited. Unless you have butler service, you cannot get room service. Also, the nicer restaurants require you the wear pants and dress shoes, but the food is not at the caliber to warrant dressier attire. I think a Hampton Inn room is nicer.
reviews.title: Poor Service for 1st time visitors!

reviews.text: This review maybe long, but we wanted to give everyone as much information as possible.

reviews.title: Absolutely PERFECT!!
reviews.text: We were at the Whitehouse from November 8th – 17th for our wedding and honeymoon. This resort was wonderful. Overall, this is one of the best vacations we have ever been on. We highly recommend the Whitehouse.

reviews.title: Fantastic ... but
reviews.text: Okay, details. We left Richmond early on the 8th and arrived in Montego Bay at 12:30. Immigration and customs was a breeze. We were only in lounge maybe 10 minutes before they called us for our bus. The bus left at 1:30. The drive – I was dreading this, as I get car sick very easily. I did take some Dramamine before we left the airport and I had no problems at all. The roads are very bumpy the second ½ of the trip. Our driver, Patrick pointed out areas as we passed them and also told us about the history of the island. We opted not to stop for a bathroom break and we were there at 3:05. We were immediately greeted with champagne and cold towels. Because we smoke, we stayed outside when everyone was brought in to get the room information. I am glad we did because it only took 5 minutes to give our credit card and our room package. We upgraded one level, from deluxe to premier, which we really did not care about. Enon took good care of us and took us with our luggage to our room in the French Village, room 2107.

reviews.title: loved the cocktail
reviews.text: The room was very nice. Our room was always clean; the fridge was stocked everyday with sodas, diet cokes, and juice. The turndown service was wonderful. They always replaced the towels we had used while getting ready for dinner.

reviews.title: The ULTIMATE Vacation Resort
reviews.text: Wednesday – After we checked in we were starving so we went to Bluefield’s to grab a little snack since it was close to dinner time. We shared the calamari and the jerk wings and both were fabulous. After we ate we swam around the French pool awhile and had a few cocktails. Once the bar closed we went back to our room to get ready for dinner. We had dinner at Arizona’s because we did not feel like dressing up. I had the steak fajitas and he had the ribs. Both were wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: I stayed at Sandals Whitehouse from June 16 - June 21, and it was my first experience at an all inclusive resort. Typically I enjoy vacations where I can sample some of the local restaurants and get away from the hotel grounds when I can, but since Sandals was offering a good package, I tried Whitehouse and was generally pleased with the experience there. I based my trip destination on TripAdvisor reviews and I swear by them when picking a location/hotel. I am well traveled so my comments will reflect on how I usually spend my time in foreign places.
reviews.title: Whitehouse - Honest Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: Arrival/Bus Trip: MBJ Airport was easy to navigate and obviously they are used to loads of tourists so security/customs were professional and fast. After meeting in the Sandals arrival lounge the porters load your bags into the minibus for the 90 minute trip to Whitehouse. The porters expect to be tipped as they are not affiliated with Sandals. I found the ride to the resort fantastic. I'm not faint of heart, and to be honest, as hard as Sandals will try, what you will see is the reality of rural Jamaican life. I get that some travelers are queasy, airsick, tired, and want to get to the resort ASAP. My advice? Enjoy it. Most travelers will feel out of their element, but that is what going somewhere is all about. After all, you didn't pick Florida. The Jamaican people are beautiful and hard-working. Watch them go about their day and wonder about their lives living here. I also tipped my driver $15 for the ride, he was appreciative, but others did not tip. I wasn't sure but it felt appropriate given he ensured our safety and the length of the trip.
reviews.title: Stunning grounds & delicious food

reviews.text: Food: Hit or miss. I love to eat well whenever I travel but at times it was a struggle here. The produce was fantastic, always fresh, especially at the breakfast buffet at Bayside which was a highlight. Ditto for Cafe Paris. I think some of the prepared foods were a spot off, nothing was inedible, but from time to time I'd eat something that didn't sit right (and I don't eat seafood). Going into this vacation I half expected that so I'm not that disappointed by it. Given the climate and resort location, I think it's unrealistic to expect top quality in every meal selection. Ironically the best meal I had was on the private dinner for two (on the beach); def. try to spring for that, it's worth the cost.

reviews.title: Rest & Relaxation
reviews.text: My husband and I spent our 4th Wedding Anniversary at Sandals Whitehouse. We were there from August 26th-September 2nd. Let me start by saying, the resort is in the middle of nowhere! It's tucked away in the beautiful green hills of Jamaica! So, you don't have to worry about any hustle and bustle of a city. The only sounds you can hear are the bartenders singing and the waves crashing in! The resort is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are clean and well kept. The food is amazing. Elanores serves a very good formal dinner and the Cafe De Paris has desserts to die for. You can't go wrong with whatever you choose! The service is oustanding. The employees truely make you feel like royalty. The waitstaff and bartenders make you feel like you're the only guests there. We have traveled to several other all-inclusive resorts and we highly recommend this property. Oh and one more thing...I would also recommend calling the resort ahead of time and arranging a private car to pick you up at the airport. This will ensure a smooth and relaxing ride to the resort. The roads are winding and long! You will enjoy the chance to take it all in without being cramped in a van with a lot of people. It's worth the extra money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited Sandals Whitehouse for our honeymoon in June 2012, it was our first time in Jamaica and we were so sad to leave! We chose Sandals Whitehouse because of its location, unlike Montego Bay, it was much more secluded and not as congested. It is about an hour and a half bus ride from Montego Bay airport through the Jamaican countryside. I will say that the ride was kind of rough...narrow winding streets through the jungle..kind of bumpy, but i never felt unsafe as the drivers of the buses know the route very well. Not as bad as some people make it seem. Our room was great, we stayed in the Italian village which is closest to the main pool and restaurants, great oceanview from our balcony. The food was great! We loved going to Bayside for the breakfast buffet-great omelets made to order, waffles, french toast, pastry's just to name a few things at the buffet. Neptune's, the seafood restaurant was another favorite. Bluefields was nice for a casual lunch by the beach...the jerk chicken is a must try!! As for the drinks-the dirty banana was my personal favorite! All the staff was friendly and welcoming, Audi, our concierge was extremely helpful and made booking excursions a breeze! The beach is beautiful and there are TONS of starfish in the water, but also watch out for sea urchins!! We found one about 15ft into the water and if you werent careful you could step on it and ruin your vacation. Overall, the resort was fantastic and would recommend it to anyone, we absolutely loved our time in Jamaica!!!
reviews.title: loved this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to Sandals Whitehouse for the first time. It was a wonderful time and will not be our last time to this resort or to a Sandals resort. We decided to take Island Hoppers to the resort, and it was the fastest and best way to reach the resort. Dougie an Island hoppers employee met us at MB airport with a warm smile and a hand shake like we knew each other for ever. He grabbed our luggage and brought us to his vehicle. It was a short ride to Island Hoppers and we had a chance to change to our Island wear and then load the Helicopter, the ride was 20 minutes and before landing we circled the resort so they would send someone to pick us up. The first person to welcome us was Sheldon from the Concierge office. Our bags wear loaded on a golf cart and we were whisked away to the concierge office to check in. The staff was warm and very helpful and once checked in we were brought to our room. The room was large and pleasant and like all rooms at the Whitehouse looked out towards the ocean. We walked around the clean and manicured grounds and ended up at Neptune’s were Marion was working the bar, and our fun began. We had a drink and met up with our other travelers in our group. The staff was absolutely wonderful, from Clinton our concierge to the entertainment staff of Shane, Geraldine, Wayon and Cheldon and specially our bar staff at the main pool from Keon and specially Anthony. I want to also thank Errol a pool life guard who after the second day layed out our beach blankets in our favorite spot from then on until we left. The food was amazing at the resort and a special thanks goes out Larry who took care of us with a couple of very special and amazing dinners he cooked up for us and our group. There are always lots to do at the Whitehouse form just laying by pool or listening to wonderful music or enjoying nightly entertainment. The staff always welcomed us when they saw us with a warm smile and their own unique hand shake which we all learned. I cannot thank them enough for making our first trip to Sandals a very memorial one.

reviews.title: Sandals Whitehouse- A magnificent DREAM vacation, best ever !
reviews.text: We just arrived home after one incredible week at Sandals Whitehouse resort Nov 2-9, 2006. We had read some reviews of the resort that were negative. I don't know which resort these people stayed at. This was THE best sun vacation we ever had. We arrived after a 11/2 drive from Montego Bay. We did not have to touch our luggage until it was placed in our room. We were offered wet towels and champagne on arrival and sat in the beautiful lobby for 10 minutes or so while our check in details were all handled by the resort staff. We were then driven by golf cart to our room in the French Village. Upon arrival, we were introduced to Kevin Hughes, the food and beverage manager for the resort. Kevin kindly made dining suggestions, reserved a table for us at the restaurant of our choice, and asked us what type of wines we preferred. Our preferred vintage was waiting for us with our table at the Bayside restaurant at the resort. Kevin ensured that we were contacted daily about our dining choices etc. and ensured that we had a great table. Kevin and his staff are THE best. We have never had such amazing service like this anywhere. His staff were very attentive, assistants Amber and Alexander, waiter Chris, chef Senior, were always willing to help and assist us at any time. I hope we didn't forget anyone. On our last night, Kevin arranged a romantic dinner for us on the beach complete with white glove service, champagne, custom menu based on discussion with us, wine, photos, and serenade from the waiters (Anthony and Vinny), waitress Shaneika (also excellent !) and Malcolm the photographer. Kevin, thanks again for making our week spectacular. I will emphasize that ALL of the Sandal's staff are totally service oriented from front desk, housekeeping, watersports, the nurse...I could go on and on. Now as for the resort, we stayed in the French village in a luxury room. The room had mahogany furniture, four poster bed and wall unit and was spotless. Towels were replaced with turndown service and housekeeping promptly dealt with any requests we had. The minibar was stocked with complimentary soft drinks and water. The french village is furthest from the main piazza but believe me, after sampling the food and snacks at all of the Sandals restaurants, we needed the walk. Each 'village' has it's own pool. The french village pool was a little more raucous and much of the pool volleyball etc was played there. We stayed mainly on the beach, the dutch village pool, (quiet..very relaxing) and the main pool, which is gorgeous and more like a lake its so large. We never had a problem getting lounge chairs or towels. We were told they allow two chairs for every guest. I'm inclined to believe that. There was a daily acquasize class at 10:30 am led by Michael in the main pool This was a blast and many guests participate. We didn't use the gym but we hear it was excellent. The watersports were of course all complimentary and we tried windsurfing and waterskiing. The staff on the beach were very helpful with instruction as well as patient. As for the food, there were many dining choices, Bayside was more continental with various meat and seafood choices. We enjoyed the ambience eating out on the patio looking at the stars, the ocean, the fountain and gardens, casually, but with 1st class service. Extra portions were never a problem and we were able to mix and match entrees, i.e. lobster tails were always available upon request and/or shrimp with any other entree. Eleanor's was more formal (no shorts or jeans) and there were many different menu choices. The filet mignon and lobster bisque was excellent and we ate there twice. Jasmine's was also very good as well with choices for Asian and Japanese food. We didn't do dinner at Giuseppe's although we did have a lunch pizza from there by the pool and it was excellent. The Cafe de Paris has wonderful pastries made on premises, soft serve and hard ice cream, and all types of coffee and lattes and is open all day and evening. The pastry chef, Parmazu (not sure if I spelled it correctly so I apologize in advance) or ParmaPoo as the staff call him (jokingly of course) is incredible. On Tuesday night, he did the chocolate buffet, do not miss this ! It is a chocoholics dream. Breakfast was available either with table service at Eleanor's or buffet at the Bayside and there was a huge selection of eggs, pancakes..you name it. The omelette stations were great as well. We paid extra to have West Indian massages at the Redlane Spa. I highly recommend it. The grounds at the resort are magnificent, clipped and manicured daily with beautiful flowers and gardens. The beach is several miles long, white sand and you can find a private spot pretty much any time. The shops at the resort are well stocked and very clean with many choices. The staff at the shops were also very helpful and a pleasure to deal with. This really is the first resort we've ever been to where we have no criticism. We plan to return next year at the same time and would go back sooner if we could swing it. If you are looking for a place to relax, be pamperd, chill out, enjoy some fine dining and enjoy total relaxation, then the Whitehouse is for you ! We will most definitely be returning ( already counting the days). We would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

reviews.text: The resort is gorgeous, very clean, reminded me of a little town with shops, restaurants and bars, and of course the delicious bakery. We stayed in the French village, a corner room on the bottom floor, about 15 steps to the pool, and a 1 minute walk to the beach. The room was fine, clean, and who cares that it isn't a master suite since you aren't in your room much. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. We had a lot of fun with our favorite bartenders Ewart, DWayne, Delano and Tummings.

reviews.title: The good, the bad, and the evil!
reviews.text: I was really impressed with one of the workers and regret I didn't get his name. We were on the beach one day, under an unbrella, and he came by to lower the umbrella since it was getting windy and could have blown over to hit someone. We didn't care, but he kept apologizing that he had to do that. He came back about 2 hours later when the wind died down to put our umbrella back up, actually dragged it over to where we were sitting to help block the hot sun. I was impressed. They will not accept tips here, so I knew he was just a genuinely nice person.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sandals Whitehouse European Village and Spa was the perfect honeymoon destination for my husband and me. We wanted the convenience of an all-inclusive resort that wasn’t huge in size, had a brilliant tropical locale, delicious dinning options, a serene spa, and an ocean-view room. We spent a great deal of time looking at Caribbean all-inclusive resorts before deciding on Jamaica to save on travel time and money. Sandals Whitehouse stuck out to us immediately, because it’s located within a 500-acre natural reserve, all the rooms had an ocean-view, and there were five gourmet restaurants to choose from.
reviews.title: An Unforgettable and Magnificent Honeymoon - We can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service at this resort was exceptional. Everyone was friendly, polite, approachable, welcoming, and eager to please. Because the resort is all-inclusive, they tell you upfront that gratuities were already paid for with the purchase of your stay, and none of the servers are looking for tips, but you will definitely feel that they deserve more than whatever they’re getting with each passing day of your vacation. They made us feel like we were guests in their home, and their hospitality left us with an extraordinary high impression of the Jamaican people and their culture. Their style is very laid-back, so check your Americanized hurriedness and hair-thin patience at the Montego Bay airport. Remember, you’re on vacation after all. Relax!
reviews.title: Great Vacation, Beautiful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a Premium Beachfront Room with a request to be in the French Building so we could have a balcony instead of a patio. Well, we were upgraded to a Luxury Beachfront Room for no extra charge upon our arrival! This meant we would have a balcony no matter which village we were located in. We were escorted to the Dutch Village with a room on the second level. The room was brightly colored with a tropical theme. The entire floor was smooth tile, the king bed was a four poster, there was a desk with comfortable chair, two nightstands, a couch with coffee table, a huge entertainment cabinet that held a TV, mini fridge that was stocked daily with pineapple juice, apple juice, orange juice, and bottled water, and a special shelf with an ice bucket and Champaign glasses. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious and included a combo tub/shower that was extra long to include a tiled bench perfect for shaving. The room also included a closet for hanging clothes and a decent-sized safe that easily held everything we wanted secured (wallet, purse, traveling documents, jewelry, etc.). The balcony was wonderful! It had a small table and two chairs for breakfast or relaxing. The greatest part was that there was a long rack to hang swimsuits on to dry – which we found to be a huge asset during our stay. The view included part of the Dutch Village pool and, of course, the beach and ocean.
reviews.title: We fell in love with each other all over again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was absolutely perfect – and completely worth the 90-minute drive! We heard stories from family members that had traveled to Jamaica before who hated being constantly harassed on the beach by peddlers. At Whitehouse, because it’s located in a natural reserve and there are no other hotels around, we had no problem enjoying quiet and relaxing time on the beach. We loved the scenic walks around the resort, and we liked that there wasn’t a massive amount of guests there.

reviews.text: We visited Sandals Whitehouse Jamaica in mid February. The temps in Nashville were 20 degrees when we left and mid 80's in Jamaica. We met some amazing Jamaican people and they now call us "Jamericans" -an honorary title given after many visits. We found the rooms in the french village beautiful and with the patio door open you can see and hear the ocean.

reviews.title: return to Sandals Whitehouse
reviews.text: The food was excellent as usual and we had great dining experience at all except Neptunes. (One of the best at Ocho Rios was the worst at Whitehouse.) Neptunes had the only poor service and inedible food in the whole resort. Bayside, Cafe Paris, Jasmines, Giuseppes, Eleanor's, and Bluefields beach club (Great chili dogs) were all excellent! The bar at the main pool (Bayside) featured fantastic bartenders Anthony & Keon. The Bayside at night had Andrew working the night shift -for when you need a late night burger. The Coca Cola and Spites in your room Frig are made with Real cane sugar & not 'high fructose corn syrup' like now in the US. Delicious - just like when I was a kid.

reviews.title: Great vacation, great staff
reviews.text: Although the entertainment dept had quality bands and musicians -the DJ's were terrible. The poolside and Beach party had a lot of guests leaving because the DJs turned the volume WAY up. They loved to hear themselves talk and the DJ 'act' was forced and unprofessional. The exception was Prince who danced with the guests and was a fantastic person. Hard working and always with a smile - we already miss him.

aka: Sandals Whitehouse European Village Hotel Whitehouse
description: Discover the undiscovered. Journey to a forgotten Jamaica where the natural beauty is simply unforgettable. Within a 500-acre wilderness preserve, blue mountains, lush palm groves, pristine coastlines and shimmering turquoise waters create an unbelievable backdrop for a monumental resort. Sandals Whitehouse Europe Village & Spa perfectly blends the exotic allure of the Caribbean with the refined elegance of Europe.Charming Italian piazzas and fountains are surrounded by gardens resplendent with fragrant foliage, while three European-inspired villages – Italian, French and Dutch – are home to luxuriously-appointed, all oceanfront rooms and suites. Each one offers magnificent views overlooking the two-mile long beach, and top tier suites come with Sandals’ legendary Butler Service. Seven restaurants serve mouthwatering gourmet cuisine from around the world, and entertainment ranges from a sophisticated piano bar to bonfire beach parties and a chic nightclub. This resort is truly a world unto itself, where time is all but forgotten and the only moment is now.World Travel Awards:Sandals Resorts “World’s Leading All – Inclusive Company”, 16 years in a row.Sandals Resorts “Caribbean’s Leading Hotel Brand,” 18 years in a row.Sandals Whitehouse “Jamaica’s Leading Spa Resort”Five Star Diamond Award, American Academy of Hospitality Sciences. We’re so very pleased to announce that Sandals Whitehouse European Villages & Spa has been named in Condé Nast Traveler’s Voted 2012 Readers' Choice Awards “Top 15 Hotels & Resorts in the Caribbean,” coming in at No. 10 and “Top 30 Resorts in the Caribbean,” coming in at No.4 as part of the annual “Best in the World” poll. Presented Certificate of Excellence for 2012 and Travelers' Choice Hotel for 2012
